Legal_Issue: Whether the officer erred in not deferring removal pending a humanitarian and compassionate (H&C) application
Application_Facts: Applicants had a pending H&C application and raised mental health concerns; officer considered medical evidence but found insufficient grounds for deferral
Remedy_Requested: Deferral of removal until H&C application was decided
Court_Ruling: Judicial review dismissed; officer's decision upheld as reasonable
Claimant_Status: Applicants under removal order with pending H&C application
Defendant_Behavior: Immigration officer denied request to defer removal
Grounds_for_Claim: Pending H&C application, mental health risks, humanitarian considerations
Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to administrative decision
Assessment_Factor: Medical evidence, risk of harm upon removal, strength of H&C application
Applicable_Legislation: Subsection 48(2) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of administrative immigration decision
Legal_Provision_Cited: Subsection 48(2), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Application_Basis: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds, mental health
Evidence_Assessed: Medical documentation and mental health risk claims
Relief_Sought: Deferral of removal pending H&C decision
Governing_Rule: Removal orders must be enforced as soon as reasonably practicable unless there are compelling reasons to defer
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient medical or psychological evidence to establish compelling risk
Outcome: Application for deferral denied; judicial review dismissed
Harm_Assessment: Alleged mental health deterioration upon removal, not accepted as compelling
Cause_Description: Applicants sought deferral of removal due to pending H&C application and mental health concerns
Evidence_Handling: Officer reviewed submitted medical evidence but found it inadequate for deferral
Evidence_Issues: Disputed weight given to mental health evidence
Legal_Provision: Subsection 48(2), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Assessment: Officer assessed medical evidence as insufficient to justify deferral
Decision_Rationale: Decision was within the range of reasonable outcomes based on available evidence
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of compelling evidence to support mental health-based deferral
